headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: Survivor Found Beneath Rubble in Turkey; Desperate Search for Survivors in Turkey; Santos Constituents Call for Resignation; Rogan Accused of Anti-Semitism. Aired 6:30-7a ET

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: This morning the death toll in the devastating earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria has risen to more than 11,000 people. CNN is now at the scene where a survivor has been reached beneath the rubble.Becky Anderson, I know that they have been trying to find this person for about 55 hours. What just happened? Can you give us the latest?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Becky, absolutely. I mean as the death toll has climbed, any stories like that, obviously, we are hoping that they are able to pull them safely out of that.Becky, we'll stay with you on the ground as that search is ongoing. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh is also live in Turkey. Nick, what are you seeing as we are now learning about just how massive this death toll really is?

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: Now since you saw that report, the body we were talking about has been removed. A Syrian refugee man, we're told by locals here, carried away in a blanket.But the pace of work of the excavators here so much faster. It does feels like they're looking for the dead here and the possibility they might come across somebody miraculously surviving, hope for that miracle is still up there on high on the rubble here. But I've got to tell you, across this city, the devastation as we've driven around, it's utterly staggering. So many buildings absolutely leveled. The body count, startling. Kaitlan. Poppy. Don.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It's just devastating.Nick Paton Walsh, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.Well, ahead, the demands from George Santos' constituents as they protest here in Washington, D.C. (COMMERCIAL BREAK) [06:45:13]

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: So, we showed you that tense exchange between Senator Mitt Romney and Congressman George Santos. There it is right there. Constituents in his congress - in the congressman's district, meantime, they took a bus here to D.C. to protest.Our very own Eva McKend has a report now. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: New York Three, Santos Free.EVA MCKEND, CNN NATIONAL POLITICS REPORTER (voice over):  Long Island residents, represented by Congressman George Santos.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Hey, hey, go home, George Santos has got to go.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Bringing their frustrations to Washington.PATRICIA CAIOZZO, CONSTITUENT OF REP. GEORGE SANTOS: You are unfit for office. You fictionalized an entire resume. TAIBA AHMAD, CONSTITUENT OF REP. GEORGE SANTOS: Your constituents are asking you to resign and please stop embarrassing us.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Traveling by bus to call on Republican leadership to expel Santos from Congress over his many lies and distortions.JODY KASS-FINKEL, CONCERNED CITIZENS OF NY-03: We have only one goal, and that is to have George Santos removed from squatting in our seat in the House of Representatives.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Speaker Kevin McCarthy has so far resisted these calls.SEN. KEVIN MCCARTHY (R-CA): If Ethics finds something, we'll take action. Right now we're not allowing him to be on committees from the standpoint of the questions that have risen.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Santos says despite his constituents' pleas, he won't resign, even as he faces multiple investigations into his finances and falsehoods.REP. GEORGE SANTOS (R-NY): That's their freedom of speech, right, and I'll entertain a discussion with them every single day. I represent them all equally.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: While we're stuck with having to beg Congress to act responsibly.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Where's George?

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Constituents delivered a petition to Santos' staff.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And where is he? He won't even speak with us.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: And tried to visit his office for a conversation.MCKEND (on camera): How do you all feel that Congressman Santos didn't come out and speak with you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's insulting.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Outrage.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It is absolutely insulting.MCKEND (voice over): Santos, later seen leaving his office.

utterances.speaker: SANTOS
utterances.sentences: I welcome the petition and I'll be corresponding with them in writing.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: And showing up at the State of the Union Tuesday night with a 9/11 first responder who suffering from a debilitating disease, bringing attention to an important issue.

utterances.speaker: SANTOS
utterances.sentences: I ask my colleagues that we work together and find a solution and have conditions such as neuropathy be covered under the World Trade Center Program Act.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: But also highlighting scrutiny of one of Santos' claims, that his mother was at the World Trade Center on 9/11 and that she became ill as a result.

utterances.speaker: SANTOS
utterances.sentences: She was in the south tower. And she made it out. She got caught up in the ash cloud. My mom fought cancer till her death.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Immigration records contradicting that claim, indicating she was in Brazil at the time of the attacks. That claim hitting close to home to constituents who were there.BEN MARZOUK, CONSTITUENT OF REP. GEORGE SANTOS: To see the deaths, to see the devastation down there, to see how many families were impacted and for him to say my mother was there, it was important to me to voice my opinion to the Republicans who are standing by him to say, you're not doing the right thing. This is not - this is not difficult. It's a fraudster. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: You know, as we continue to cover the Santos saga, it's really important to remember the constituents, right? Something that undoubtedly takes a hit when your member is embroiled in so many scandals is constituent services. A woman I met yesterday, she works with Afghan refugees. She says, listen, I work with federal lawmakers all the time. I don't feel comfortable working with my congressman because I don't trust his office with sensitive information. So, this is something that we will continue to monitor.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes. Not often that you see the members, right?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Of the community, the people who voted for you, come out and say, no more.

utterances.speaker: MCKEND
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's not a common sight.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Yes.Thank you, Eva. Appreciate that:

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: The podcast host, Joe Rogan, is now facing criticism after he pushed the anti-Semitic trope that Jewish people are, quote, into money.Here's what he said. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) JOE ROGAN, PODCAST HOST, "THE JOE ROGAN EXPERIENCE": Ilhan Omar, where she's - she's apologizing for talking about it's all about the benjamins.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: Which is just about money. She's talking about money.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: She -- she shouldn't have apologized. I mean I'll go ahead and say it.

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: That was not - that's not an anti-Semitic statement. I don't think that is. It's about -- benjamins are money. You know, the idea that Jewish people are not into money is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Listen -

utterances.speaker: ROGAN
utterances.sentences: That's like saying Italians aren't into pizza. It's (EXPLETIVE DELETED) stupid.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: CNN media analyst and "Axios" media reporter, Sara Fischer, is joining us now.Sara, I mean, what are people saying about that moment?

utterances.speaker: SARA FISCHER, CNN MEDIA ANALYST
utterances.sentences: People are outraged. But at this point people are kind of getting used to this being a pattern with Joe Rogan. This isn't the first time that he's defended people who've made anti-Semitic remarks. Obviously, he's now coming out and making them. And I think people are frustrated that Spotify hasn't said anything yet but historically they take their time to respond to these things.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But you talked to Daniel Ek, who's the CEO of Spotify, about this. What did he say?

utterances.speaker: FISCHER
utterances.sentences: Not about this specifically but about these bigger issues.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But about this bigger issue.

utterances.speaker: FISCHER
utterances.sentences: Sure.This is something that Spotify is been talking about for a long time, how do they think about content moderation, because they're not the same as Google and Facebook, they're a different kind of platform. Ultimately, obviously, they'll say that they care a lot about safety. But, remember, they're a Swedish company. So they think about these things and how they play out in the U.S. a little bit differently. The one thing that distinguishes Spotify and Daniel from other tech CEOs is they take their time. You're not going to see some sort of rushed policy implemented today. They'll probably come out and condemn these remarks. Maybe they'll throw a misinformation label. And then presumably everything will just move on. I'm not saying that that's what it should be, but that's what's happened in the past with Joe Rogan.

utterances.speaker: FISCHER
utterances.sentences: It's definitely not going to hurt Joe Rogan. It's not going to hurt Spotify. They do have some policies. But you're right, streaming is the wild, wild west of content moderation.

utterances.speaker: LEMON
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Sara.

utterances.speaker: FISCHER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.
